thread.title: Casualty exit ahead for Sam Strachan but he won't be gone for good | Metro News
thread.title_full: Casualty exit ahead for Sam Strachan but he won't be gone for good | Metro News

author: Duncan Lindsay For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Casualty exit ahead for Sam Strachan but he won't be gone for good | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 6:02 pm (Picture: BBC) 
Casualty fans are getting used to seeing Holby City character Sam Strachan more regularly in Casualty but it’s not going to last forever as actor Tom Chambers has revealed that he has other commitments that will take him away from the show later this year – but don’t worry, he won’t be gone forever. 
Since Sam’s daughter Grace was injured in the helicopter crash last year, Sam has been more prominent in the show and fans have seen him prepare to take Grace away from Connie Beauchamp in order to continue her recovery. 
But before long, Sam will land a permanent job at the ED which will pit him against several characters, with high drama on the way including a staff strike. 
Over the course of the months though, we will see a (likely temporary) exit for Sam as Tom heads off to take part in a musical. 
He explained to Inside Soap : ‘I’m contracted on another job later in the year, a musical called Crazy for You. We did a stint last year at the Watermill Theatre in Newbury, and we’re touring it around the UK – it’s my favourite musical, so I’m chuffed to be doing it. ‘I think Casualty was hoping it would fall through so I could stay on a bit longer – but I’ve promised I’ll be back as soon as the tour is over!’ Phew! As much as Sam likes to ruffle feathers, we can’t get enough of Tom in Casualty. If he didn’t return, we’d likely be the ones calling a strike…
